newsitem.title: INDIA: India energy meeting to see 24 oil ministers.
newsitem.headline: India energy meeting to see 24 oil ministers.

text.p: Oil ministers from at least 24 countries, including Venezuela, Kuwait, Nigeria and Saudi Arabia, are among those expected to attend a conference of oil producers and consumers in India in December, officials said on Friday.

India's junior petroleum minister T.R. Baalu told reporters in New Delhi that invitations had been sent to 54 countries to attend the fifth International Energy Conference in Goa, and 24 had so far confirmed participation at ministerial level.
Baalu said the meeting would be a "forum for high level political dialogue in the field of energy among major oil producer and consumer countries".
He said the conference to be held from December 6 to 8 is being organised to facilitate exchange of views on the global energy scenario at the highest level.
A Petroleum Ministry statement said Rilwanu Lukman, Secretary-General of Organisation of Petroleum Exporting countries (OPEC), had confirmed his participation.
Other countries to be represented at the ministerial level are Oman, United Arab Emirates, Iran, Egypt, Malaysia, Indonesia, Bangladesh and Qatar.
The meeting will discuss growing energy needs of emerging economies and the strategic importance of oil and natural gas.
It will also discuss formulating a global energy policy.
"Various bilateral agreements will be signed during the course of the conference," Sanjiv Mishra, a senior official in the Petroleum Ministry said. He did not give any other details.
"India will interact with every nation for the betterment of (India's) the oil sector," Baalu said.
The previous four international energy conferences were held at France, Norway, Spain and Venezuela.
